intro: Periomphale pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri periomphale, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Periomphale pancheri is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
